author: babyxbt
sky.cactus
content: I don't think "the community" understands the tradeoff being made.  See Polygon/BSC as case studies of people being surprised by state bloat after they run with crazy high gas bandwidth for a while.

author: timbeiko
content: Maybe in 6 months they will, based on these experiments üòÖ  But I tend to agree, and also think that some may get the tradeoff and be OK doing it for the short-term benefits because they won't be there to deal with the long term consequences, and that's very hard to tell

author: pepesza.eth
content: Thank you, Micah! ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: norswap
content: I'm looking for transaction data that includes signatures values. Is there a way where I can easily obtain this, or should I just run a node and write custom code to dump the data? (Doesn't seem to be available on EtherScan or the BigQuery dataset.)

author: norswap
content: Yes, that's perfect üëç

author: jgm
content: https://github.com/wealdtech/ethereal

author: norswap
content: Nice, looks like I'll need to run a node anyway, but this makes it very easy to query!

author: jgm
content: You can supply a connection, for example your own infura link.  If you are going to pull down lots of data you'd be better off with your own node, but if it's only occasional requests infura should be fine.

author: traveladdikt
content: Hi all! new on here, sorry if my question has been talked about before (it most likely did) been asking around and someone pointed out this discord group for the answer. im running validators, and was wondering when withdrawal will be available if we will be able to withdraw only the rewards and keep the validator running or this hasn‚Äôt been determined yet? Thx

author: djrtwo
content: withdrawals will likely be available at a fork soon after the merge

author: djrtwo
content: and there are designs under consideration for withdrawing any ETH in excess of the 32 ETH base

author: djrtwo
content: I think it is very likely such a proposal makes it in there. Otherwise, it incentivizes high churn on the validator set

author: 0xsadcat
content: is mev-incentivized block orphaning a valid reason for an accelerated merge? <:peepothink2:754852084121206824>

author: 0xsadcat
content: https://twitter.com/mevintern/status/1413133648036040704

author: 0xsadcat
content: in theory for eg. a big hack or liquidation bounty it could mean hours of chain being constantly orphaned as pools battle for supremacy

author: chris2_2_2
content: most of the big pools don't run mev-geth plus 100 eth is less than 50 blocks of income.

author: 0xsadcat
content: he was writing about over 100 eth, so it could as well be 50k eth (hack most likely)

author: 0xsadcat
content: some orphaning is already happening. I know of cases of trades on taichi being frontrun in non-sparkpool blocks. which means someone started constructing them after seeing the original block, so it was intentional
